metadata.title: CVE-2022-0850 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in linux kernel, where an information leak occursvia ext4_extent_header to userspace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0850` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-84-generic - 5.4.0-84.94
linux-image-5.4.0-84-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-84.94
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-84-generic - 5.4.0-84.94
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-84-lowlatency - 5.4.0-84.94
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-21-generic - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-5.13.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-21-generic - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-21-generic-64k - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-21-lowlatency - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1046-kvm - 5.4.0-1046.48
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-84.94').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11').
linux-hwe-5.11: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.13').
linux-hwe-5.13 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1046.48').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1056.59').
